relevantProvisions.title: Total Small Business Set-Asides
relevantProvisions.applicationToScenario: This provision requires setting aside acquisitions between micro-purchase and simplified acquisition thresholds for small businesses. Since the $145,000 purchase exceeds micro-purchase threshold and market research shows capable small businesses, it must be set aside for small business competition unless exceptions apply.

relevantProvisions.title: Effect of Listing
relevantProvisions.applicationToScenario: This prohibits contracting with debarred or proposed for debarment contractors. Since two potential suppliers appear on proposed debarment list, they must be excluded from consideration unless agency head determines compelling reason exists to use them.

relevantProvisions.title: Sustainable Acquisition Policy
relevantProvisions.applicationToScenario: Requires 95% of new contracts to meet sustainability criteria. Since computers/printers must be ENERGY STAR certified, this provision mandates including these requirements in the solicitation and evaluating offers accordingly.

complianceIssues.issueDescription: Lack of formal supplier qualification process and failure to check exclusion lists
complianceIssues.correctiveAction: Implement documented supplier qualification procedures including verification of certifications/licenses and checking against government exclusion lists. Create standardized supplier evaluation forms and maintain records of qualification activities for each supplier.

complianceIssues.issueDescription: Undisclosed conflict of interest with Purchasing Manager's brother-in-law's company
complianceIssues.regulationViolated: Federal Anti-Kickback Statute (42 U.S.C. ยง 1320a-7b(b))
complianceIssues.correctiveAction: Immediately disclose the relationship, implement conflict of interest policy requiring annual disclosures, and recuse the Purchasing Manager from decisions involving this supplier. Consider competitive bidding for future orders.

complianceIssues.issueDescription: Inadequate documentation of purchase requirements and changes
complianceIssues.correctiveAction: Implement document control procedures requiring written specifications, formal change orders for modifications, and retention of records for required period. Train staff on proper documentation practices and implement quality checks.

scenarioDecisions.correctAction: Do not proceed with this supplier until certification can be verified. Request current certification documents directly from the certifying body. If time is critical, identify alternative certified suppliers or consider delaying production until proper verification is complete.

Require supplier to provide complete conflict minerals reporting template (CMRT) with detailed supply chain information. Conduct due diligence to verify conflict-free status before purchase. Implement conflict minerals policy and reporting procedures to ensure SEC compliance.

Do not accept outdated SDS documents. Require supplier to provide current GHS-compliant SDS before purchase. Verify TSCA compliance status of all chemical components. Consider alternative suppliers with proper documentation if timely updates cannot be provided.

Make good faith effort to meet small business subcontracting goals. Solicit bids from both the established large business and qualified small business. If small business can meet requirements at fair price, award to them. Document decision-making process for compliance reporting.
